review: There are some mistakes people shouldn't make in life. One mistake a person could make is trying to climb a tree in the middle of a thunder storm. Another mistake a person could make is going to Cheesecake factory, pulling out some cheeseburgers from McDonald's and only asking the server for plenty of free water and napkins. My mistake was going to this particular T.G.I. Fridays on a Friday night.  Without further delay, here is my review. The good: Um... the food that I ordered was hot The bad: Everything else- I arrived at this Friday's with a date around 9:45pm last night. As expected, the place was a mad house. As I walked through the front door, I couldnt help but notice that a member of Chesterfield's finest was walking right behind me. Though I didnt have any outstanding warrants or smell like Marijuana, the presence of a police officer to serve as security inside a restaurant should have been a precursor for bad things to come.  When in the lobby, I noticed that there was no hostess to greet customers, yet there were about 8 customers waiting to be seated. My date and I made our way to the bar area only to find that the bar was completely full to the point where people were aimlessly standing around in the area, blocking any paths to get to the bartender. So we made our way back to the lobby area which had cleared out by that time, more than likely because some customers just walked out. But my date wanted to stay so I took a big sigh, and waited for the invisible hostess to appear. 5 minutes later, the manager appears, greets us and finds the hostess to have us seated. We are seated and thats where the fun begins.  Once seated, 10 minutes passed until we saw our server. Luckily the preseason NFL game was on during the wait period, but as soon as 10:00pm hit, a DJ started playing deafening Hip Hop music throughout the restaurant. It was at that time that I realized why the police officer was standing near the restaurant's enterance. Fast forward to the servers initial appearance. By the time the server finally arrives, we give the server our drink orders and order food. The server magically disappears and reappears about 7 minutes later with the drinks. My food was brought out about 25 minutes after ordering and though it was hot, my patience had already worn thin with the bad service and club music being played through the restaurant. The server never once looked at my empty cup and asked if I needed a refill. So indeed this experience could only be described as 100% FRESHLY SQUEEZED BOOTY JUICE!!! Overall:  I've been to this particular Friday's during regular hours and had better experiences when the crowd sizes are normal. Granted the restaurant had a full house last night, I feel that the management could have been more organized and the service could have been better. But the next time I see a police officer just posting up near a door in a chain restaurant, I will know to carry myself right back out the door.  ONE STAR.

Very poor overall will not go back to this Friday's just plain poor.  Service fair at best from hostess to manager who really didn't want to speak with customers.  Waitress was OK at least she attempted to fix things.  Side order of fries missed got in middle of meal.  Burger was over cooked had pickles that we're request to be left off should have checked before biting into sandwich.  Margarita was requested not straight Tequila while I have no problems with Tequila shots again not what I wanted.  Overall just poor.  Management needs to reevaluate themselves and employees.  Should be Zero Stars.  Visited on 09/28 took the TGIF out of Friday Night

Went to this establishment about a week ago because my wife and I eat T.G.I's back home. I have to say this was the worst place I have ate at in a long time. I ordered a burger and the meat was completely over cooked, my wife ordered the bulgogi tacos and the meat in that was burnt also. The reason I even gave this place 1 star is because the manager came out and checked our food and took the items off our bill. Then gave my wife's replacement meal to us for free, so she ordered a rueben which was so greasy that by time we made it home my wife was sick. Over all HORRIBLE experience, will never return to that location again.
Bad service. Bland Burger.  A whopper has more flavor. Waitress more interested in flirting with coworkers than serving customers, never asked to refill my drink. Will never go back.

This place is straight hood. The employees are loud and slow. One of the employee here has his son and passing him around to different employees and they are not washing their hands. And the restrooms are filthy.

Worst Friday's I've been to. Service is awful, the hostess is awkward and RUDE. The broad street one is just as bad, but somehow this one gets worse. Don't go here, the food isn't worth it. And they leave you hanging for about 30 min.

Some friends and I went to this fine establishment after a long day of boozing on the golf course . We were already buzzed so any kind of food covered in hot sauce and ranch would make us happy. We walk in and took our seat at the bar. We immediately were overwhelmed by the smell. It smelled like that stuff they use to clean up puke on the school bus. I decided to tough it out and only breathe through my mouth. As I sat down my forearms stuck to the bar. The bar keep came over and took our orders. I ordered a liquor drink and the dude went into some sketchy corner to make our drinks. The drink wasn't terrible so we decided to order some grub. We all ordered the trio like a bunch of fat kids. The bar keep didn't write any of our orders down. We knew immediately we were doomed. As he punched our orders in the computer he turned to us and retook our orders. There was no way this was going to be right. We sat there waiting for our food, while using our shirts as gas masks. Whenever they opened the front doors the breeze would gag us. The food finally comes out and all four of us had our orders wrong. Not only were they wrong but they were not even close. We didn't care. We had to get out of there before somebody we knew came on and caught us. So we paid our tabs and left. Today I sit on the toilet trying to get this food out of my body. I am sweating, cramping and deciding if I should send TGI Fridays a bill for the clothes I had to burn as a result of the smell. In closing, this place is awful. Don't go. You will lose 6 lbs on the toilet, burn all of your clothes and wake up with a face full of pimples.

So I will give this location 4 stars for the fact 1) our waitress named Alyssa was good at talking and making conversation, really sweet and very attentive. 2) the dining room and bar look upgraded and nice on the inside. Other than that though, if those two things weren't so impressive, it's at most a three based on food. I did love the $5 boneless wings and drinks. But I got a steak mr, very pink which was good but no juiciness at all. Mashed potatoes had no flavor. Boyfriend got ribs he said they had barely any flavor and we're not "fall off the bone" and both of our fries were very hard and cold.

I was craving Jack Daniels Steak, medium rare...but never got it. It came rare (with a lukewarm red center...not dark pink and juicy like I prefer) Ok, fine, I can just send it back to "cook a couple more minutes" right?  It came back a new steak, cooked very well done. When it came back, my entire table was finished with their meals. They ordered the All-American burger and fries and a sirloin (also slightly overcooked, but enjoyed). Their food was delicious! The bottomline: the kitchen service was, in fact, slow and leaves much to be desired. Thankfully, our server, Tyler, was polite and attentive. Also, this experience received one more star than I intended to give because the manager was apologetic, took ownership of the problem, and took the steak off my bill.

Looked at menu online at this specific location.  Left the Sheraton Four a Points at 9pm ready to have Korean Tacos and a milkshake.  Arrived, was seated immediately. Waitress came immediately so I told her what I wanted.  "Sorry, we don't have Korean tacos nor have we ever had them. We don't have milkshakes either."   Ok. Please bring me a glass of water.  Waitress returns with my water and says, "I was told we can make a milkshake."  So I said ok, I'd like a vanilla milkshake.  She returns with a "milkshake" and the glass is dripping on the outside so it's going to be a sticky mess to pick up the glass.  Anyway, started to drink the milkshake. And guess what!  It was essentially some milk, a small amount of ice cream and 90% ice blended. Can you F'ing believe this?  Never in my life.  So I told the waitress and asked it to be removed from the bill.  The entire trip was an abysmal mess.

Waiting 5 minutes for a table when the parking lot was barely filled.  Then waited 10 minutes and no one even came to take a drink order.  We left.  2 kids under 5 only wait so long.  Will not be coming back.

6:45 on a Saturday we went into TGI Fridays that had a 20 minute wait with other people waiting. When we walked around the restaurant we noticed that there were SIX tables ready to be cleaned. Why are people waiting for so long when there are tables available?? The hostess also turned a blind eye to the amount of people waiting. Friday's lost our business as we went to another restaurant. Horrible service and experience

Sunday I had experience I'd rather have foregone.  Since the McDonald's CEO closed Famous Dave's I have been seeking good dry rub ribs.  With Fridays about a month ago, I thought perhaps I had succeeded, as on that visit I ordered the Memphis Ribs full rack.  Memphis means dry rub, no wet sauces added, and that was what I had. At that time I ordered the cole slaw, a mistake I'll not repeat.  On This past Sunday's visit, I ordered the Memphis Ribs again, but this time they were soaked in sauces and the rub wasn't "rubbed" just sprinkled over the top. Not satisfied, I asked for the manager.. (Chris Winder) he was on duty.  When I explained the problem all he said was this is how we always do them, to which I replied they weren't done this way last time. He insisted I was wrong (I'm a liar) and I said fine. As he seemed to want to carry on further I asked him to please leave, as we had finished our "conversation". I won't be returning there, and I suggest others do the same.

Friday's is going down hill. No matter where u go, state or city, they have forgotten what Friday's was about. Stop focusing in investing in menu changes and print outs, what about training the staff, cleaning the place or improving service.  Their deals r not deals anymore!

I've been to many T.G.I. Friday's over the years and sadly I must say this experience exemplifies why it's been 10 years since I've been.  Their mailed coupon brought me in to try it, and while the food wasn't bad, it just wasn't anything above meh. I had a burger with fries. The burger was over-cooked and the fries were cool as if they'd set in the window for an extra 5-10 minutes (about as long as I'd been looking around for the bartender/waiter to ask for a second beer.)   The service was lacking in most every way. One of the bartenders was friendly and helpful, even bringing the condiments before the food arrived, but the other two were just not into being at work this day. Sadly, the helpful bartender was only present when I first arrived. One of the others was watching a video on a fellow guest's phone for several minutes while ignoring us and other patrons, who were also waiting with empty beer glasses, and the other waiter just disappeared.   This was one of the few recent times I didn't read previous Yelp reviews before choosing a restaurant, but I wish I had. In the end, the coupon wasn't worth it. I'm not trying to be dramatic, but even now as I think about it, I'm annoyed.

Sort of rough neighborhood, being from out of town it seemed to be bad anyway.  we got a few beers and some of the endless appetizers, it was ok the door greeter was rude but the waitress was pretty nice!  was not expensive but got overloaded with the potato skins and fried cheese!

Worst service ever! Messed up one of our entrees and took over 30 minutes to fix it!! Asked to speak to manager and he wouldn't come  Out of kitchen and made his server do the dirty work! Heard other tables asking for manager and he never appeared. Asked for the time Free which they agreed to and then didn't take off the bill!! Serious problems here!!

Worst TGIFridays I have ever been!!! Worst service, if you have hours to wait for the server you go right ahead!! Was sited after waiting for 10 minutes (no one was in front of me and there was no one at the restaurant) when I finally was sited the server never came, so we just got up and left we had waited enough mind you that there was no one in the restaurant!! This was not the fist time I was there and every time the service is worst!! Argh the worst

The atmposhere was perfect. Not to quiet that my toddlers were distractions, and not to loud that we struggled with conversation. The food was wonderful. This was our first time at the Midlothian TGIFridays and it really did trump any other Friday's experience we have had. Food= delicious, Our server= awesome, overall experience= exceptional. We will for sure be back to enjoy another exceptional dinner. THANK you!
Great service at this location. I will be returning here, drinks were great and endless wings were delicious

This was probably one of the worst experiences I have had at a restaurant. We requested a table for 2 and told that it would be a 20-30 minute wait; I kid you not. THERE WAS ATLEAST 10 open tables which only means one thing. UNDERSTAFFED! So we waited even after that initial disappointment. We were seated and greeted by our server that took our initial drink orders and appetizers. Cool! Then after a lengthy 15 minute wait, we FINALLY received our drinks (not even the appetizer yet!) she said those would be out shortly. We finally get those and she ask to order dinner. I had a question about something on the menu and she says to me; Im not the one to answer that question; I really don't know. I ordered a more simpler meal, chicken tenders and kept it going. I would'nt spend another dime at this place. Very horrible experience with an incapable server and obviously bartender and cooks. Pathetic!

Please  do yourself a favor and save it  from a horrible dinning experience,we went on a saturday with our two kids it's was noon and our kids already had a late breakfast at home so we ordered for ourselves and  one more for the kids to share ,our waitress was the rudest waitress we ever had in a restaurant( I think her name was holly)  she took her time getting our drinks and what we got was the worst watered down coke (disgusting)she slapped the drinks down on table and ran a way ,we were like what the hell is wrong with her,then the food came and she served it the same way she put down the drink ,I ordered a chicken salad the chicken was dry and cold like it was made the day before ,I would forgive the food if the service was decent but it's was a nightmare ,that waitress made sure we will never be back to the restaurant nor we will recommend it to any one.funny thing this visit was my first to a  TGI Friday restaurant(husband said I should try it )and it will be my last ,this experience will turn to one  of those stories you tell you friends about the worst restaurant you been to.
If you like crappy food that comes out of a plastic bag and want to support corporate america instead of local cafes...

Went with hubby, we were returning from Richmond Jazz Festival and wasn't a meal not fast food. TGIF fit the bill we haven't been in years, they were open to 2am. I had a chicken Caesar salad, and hubby had the Flank Steak which enjoyed greatly. My salad was okay. The service took a while.  I would return again you can't beat the menu offerings that late in the night. Service could have been better though.

I'm so mad I didn't check the reviews before eating there! This was the worst experience we have ever had at a restaurant! The one star is for the hostess because she greeted us with a smile,  and asked how we were doing and was pleasant! My husband asked our waitress ,with no personality, if the chicken sliders were grilled or fried and she told him that they were grilled (but no they were fried chicken tenders cut in half) He also asked for ghost pepper sauce on side and it came on the slider instead.  Our meals came out separately with a 4 minute wait between each delivery. We each ordered a salad (which came out with our entrées) and two of the salads had no dressing at all and my salad had dressing on it (even though I asked for it on the side) Salads  were fine but the entrées were terrible!  My spicy chicken pasta was bland, so I ordered some jalapeños to spice it up. When  we got our bill they charged $3.99 for the jalapeños (the manager ended up refunding that).  We will never dine here again!!!!

My friend and I had a great experience here last night! She's a member of their "Stars & Stripes" program, so we had endless, complimentary chips and salsa. The tortilla chips were warm and salty and the salsa was great! Our server was really fantastic and won extra points for accommodating all of our miscellaneous, special requests and for being patient with us.  My turkey burger & fries were great, and my friend raved about their yummy "beer & cheese" pub pretzels appetizer. Even my friend's toddler was happy, so it was a win all around! This location treated us right!

Worst Friday's I have ever been in. Sliders were overcooked. Fruit flies everywhere. Arms stuck to the bar in something. Didn't get ketchup with my fries. Strange smell throughout the restaurant. Bathrooms were dirty.
Visited this location multiple times. Service is slow and the servers seem to have attitude. Definitely will check yelp to see if things have been turned around before returning.

This has to be the worst Friday's!! It took over an hour and a half to get our food. They also continuously delivered us another table's food. The waitress also lacked any professional courtesy. It's a Tuesday night and not busy. Ordered the sampler and the food was cold. I wouldn't recommend this location to anyone!! If you're hungry don't come here.

I am giving this place two stars based solely on the kind manager who took pity on us and comped our round of drinks because the experience we had here was ridiculous. We arrived around 9:30 on a Wednesday night. The restaurant was busy, but certainly not slammed. We were a group of 8. The hostess seated us at two tables of four. When we started pushing the tables together she told me that that was a fire hazard and that we couldn't push the tables together. Are you telling me that TGIFs never has groups larger than 4 who want to sit together? I have no idea whether this is a rule or not since no restaurant has ever stopped me from pushing tables together. So we sat separated. We ordered drinks. Not crazy fancy drinks--wine and beer. We waited  1/2 hour and still no drinks arrived. Seriously? I could go pour myself a draft in about 20 seconds. Our food came out and our drinks still hadn't arrived. We finally complained to a manager who took great care of us. To say that our server was incompetent is being generous. I'm not a big fan of chain restaurants, but the one thing you can usually count on is uniformity in training. Never again.

My rating is for server Elizabeth!!!! She was so sweet and understanding when I was beyond picky with my order! Super sweet and she really deserves all her tips!  Drinks weren't strong at all more watery but shrugs it's Friday's!

They need to replace the whole entire TGI Friday team ! This is the type of TGI Friday that needs to be investigated to make sure they follow their mission statement .I don't even think they do any type of reference check or background check before they hire the managers or employees . Example store manager Maurice Lewis. Details will be sent to corporate. I wouldn't recommend this TGI FRIDAY for anyone !
The server Frank here at Fridays on Midlothian is absolutely amazing! If you ever are in the area stop by and see him.

Three stars is actually fabulous, b/c, after all..it IS a Friday's.... MY disclaimer, though...as others have mentioned...is this (HOPEFULLY!!!!) used to be the worst Friday's I'd ever set foot into.  It appears things (may have...) changed?!?!  Fingers crossed! NOW...onto my review...after swearing off this location, guess what?  I was back.  Not by my choosing...it was late-ish & the BF got home starving & craving their "Endless Aps".  Sigh....  Being the fab GF that I am, I (begrudgingly...) agreed.  Wow!  Our server, Tamoria was SPOT ON!  I also noticed, there were a ton of runners & even the bartender walked over to check on us. Seems they're going for more of a 'teamwork' approach?  Idk what it is, but it won me over & I'll return.  The entire staff had smiles on their faces the entire time & they were SLAM PACKED!!!  BRAVO!!!!!!!!!!

Wait staff very friendly,  but quite a LONG wait for our food considering it was NOT busy at ALL and there was no reason for it to be so.  My BFF requested her chicken be pretty much over cooked,  or "burnt"  to be specific,  but it was barely done.   I asked for my sirloin to be medium,  though I was thinking of asking for it to be medium-rare in case it was over-cooked --which is exactly what it ended up being...over-cooked.  The sesame jack chicken strips were delicious though!    They have this awesome new bubble tea available that I partook of and I'm super glad I did!  I really wanted to provide 3 stars because the waiter was great,  but the wait and the deviations from how we ordered our food made it so I had to deduct a star.

First let me start by saying that the staff were super friendly and helpful. We had a wonderful server and she was very attentive.  The food was blah. Bland, unseasonably bland and not wonderful. I ate half and didn't bring it home.

I ordered a mozzarella tomato salad as a side replacement and it was the worst cheese I've had. It certainly doesn't look fresh. The cheese was bitter so I didn't finish it. I brought it to the servers attention and she said that the cheese is supposed to be bitter.

Now avoiding this franchise.  Walked in went to the host and told them I was here to pick up a online order for Harris. Then I waited 50 mins before a waitress walked up and said the name Harris. I walked up and it was the wrong order. I stated it wasn't my order and she said "oh you must not have heard me then, I said Hairrs" I smiled and said "yes, My name is harris". She walked away and no one came back out to figure out what was going on with my order or even talk to me. After simply asking for a refund so I can leave I was asked did my order come to the correct store I stated the store number in my electronic receipt. And not to my surprise, neither of the two ladies even know what the store number was. I was told it would take 24/72 hours to get my money back for the food I never received. Of course not to my surprise again. Patiently awaiting the ZERO star update for yelp ‍

I'm giving this one star because no stars is not an option. I came here on Thursday evening to have dinner with my boyfriend at 10pm at night. Within 12 minutes they turned the music up so loud I literally could not hear my boyfriend speak across the table. We asked the waitress what was going on and she said "this is how it is on Thursdays"......apparently they hire a DJ on Thursdays to play music that could drown out a club sound track while people are trying to eat. The guests around us were visibly uncomfortable but the staff seemed to ignore the music level regardless. The waitress set the check down and rushed away. After we paid and asked the hostess if this was normal she explained that "the guests always complain about it'.......why is this allowed?? It's Fridays not a club? I can make cheap fried food at home without bad 80s music so loud it hurts my ears and drowns out all conversation.

I'm soooo not surprised to have to give this place a low review, yet it's consistent with the current 2 star rating.  The Ill mannered hostess who answered my call as I drove the 4 mins here, looked like "awww, damn" when she saw me walk in with my phone in my hand...  as she looked at her phone still flashing, yet too scared to pick it up or address the obvious for another 2 mins.  I finally called her out once the server came to take my order.   I'm here because it's late and I don't want fast food AND I have a BOGO coupon.  The manger tried to apologize and salvage the debacle unfolding only gave 50% effort at best.  One of the ladies behind the bar was attentive, apologetic and saved their receiving a (1) Star....  I'll stay away from this location when possible.  The up side is that the food was hot as ordered.

Went to TGIFridays with our volleyball team at the MLK Richmond tournament. So accommodating and Nick the bartender did a great job with a big crowd. Definitely recommend coming. Family environment and great staff!
